pages.text: I've done quite a bit at this point - seen many of the biomes the world has to offer, plunged into the cavernous depths, discovered old structures and ruins, fought off countless monsters. I don't see myself stopping any time soon, either.$(br2)But something is bothering me. Having seen what I've seen so far, and done the

things I've done so far, there's something that feels vaguely off. Quite a few things I've encountered can't really be explained easily; from a structure that had some weird markings, objects that had unusual features to creatures that seem... foreign. I try to shrug off this feeling, but my gut tells me that it can't be ignored. The tattered journal I picked up earlier - some pages in it seem to imply that other...worlds,

vastly far from my current reach, are out there.$(br2)Somewhere.$(br2)If it's one thing I've learned, it's that I can't just ignore my intuition - it's helped me survive this long. I should pay close attention to whatever else I may find or see moving forward; there may be some sort of clue out there that can lead me down a new road entirely. Of course, I can't be too

hasty about this. If these other worlds exist, they may be even more dangerous than what I've already become tenuously accustomed to here. There will be great reward, I'm sure - that Harvester spirit I killed lent a hefty scythe, though it almost did its job on me; I suspect future prospects will be similar.$(br2)Always remember: $(bold)bravery is vital, but my arrogance may prove to be lethal.
